name: El Guarapo Apartments

reviews.text: Booked through Midlands Co-op Travel. Target budget £1500 including parking, target reached.
reviews.title: Great value apartments suffer for poor maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spec of apartments as stated, pool area acceptable.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception and pool bar very relaxed.
reviews.title: Another fantastic week at Guarpo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location very useful for town.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay...again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is windy, as most of the Island.
reviews.title: Great place to unwind on a budget!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: visited for the first time 5/7/2013 for 7 days. Very helpful and welcoming on arrival and throughout our stay. Great superior room with balcony overlooking the pool and gardens. Lovely swimming pool and pretty well kept gardens. Centre of the resort only 10 mins walk along a lovely promenade or 5 mins walk along a path through gardens at the rear of the complex. Having been to Costa Teguise on numerous trips in the past I can say that this small family owned complex is well run and we will definitely return again in the future.This small and friendly complex compares favourably to others in the resort at a similar price.
reviews.title: Perfect Location-clean,value complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 9 days at this lovely apartment complex and have to say it was one of the best holidays! Highly recommended for its location, apartments (big and clean), quietness, outdoor pool, bar & restaurant and a very very friendly staff. And, of course, for great price.
reviews.title: Best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from two weeks at the El Guarapo apartments ,though the apartment was lovely,the complex was very quiet ,no atmosphere,no music around the pool ,the pool bar wasnt open all day closed in the middle of the afternoon,didnt have a variety of cold drinks or ice creams. The apartments were not cleaned everyday,only had clean towels about three times in two weeks, not very good in a hot country .
reviews.title: Recent stay at el Guarapo apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned again and were not disappointed the accommodation was well maintained and the additional touches of providing water and wine as a welcome gift was much appreciated. We were also pleased with the beach towels provided. We have booked again for 6 weeks in the winter and cant wait to return
reviews.title: recent visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from our 2 weeks at the El Guarapo, our room no 44 was excellent, 2 bedrooms with seaview and very clean. The room was nicely presented with a splash of accent coulourin alll rooms and African theme pictures/carvings. The apartment also had a touch of modern design fetures (ikea) with flat screen tv, with british channels. We had upgraded and got beach towels, TV remote, WiFi, water and wine. The room was cleaned regually and towels/sheets changed. We fouund NO ants, cockroachs etc ! The El Guarapo was very wellmaintained and we often saw the maintance man with a pot of white paint or fixing things, the gardener was planting, pruning and the whole place was of a very hih standard. The staff 'Hana' was friendly and helpful. Thank you to all at the El Guarapo well done
reviews.title: EL GREATO
Minor comments
reviews.text: I stayed in the El Guarapo for 1 week arriving home last night.Despite the complex being spotless clean.On the day of leaving they wanted me out of my room by 8.30am even though it said 12pm on the paperwork.Also there was no where to have a shower or get changed before leaving the hotel even though there was somewhere to put suitcases if you wanted to go into town.Also most of the reception staff times are strange(It's not open 12hrs) and its closed on Saturdays yet open for 3hrs on Sunday.Most places have someone there every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel but be warned.
reviews.title: El guarapo

reviews.text: Arrived at the el guarapo on the 4th sept, reception wasn't open so had to the emergency number to speak to a lady who told us our room number and that the key was inside with a small bit of info we then had to check in the following morning we had room 22 on the first floor. I will get the moan out of the road first, we were booked into a superior room when on arrival you had a bottle of wine /water / flat screen tv and beach towels not in room 22 as I don't think it was a superior room and it had not been renovated Right that is the moan over. The room itself was clean but very dated it did need renovate ing the sheets were clean as was the whole apartment and everything you needed. The towels once again dated. The staff who looked after the apartments and the gardens where very good no issues at all. The on site restaurant was good I enjoyed the breakfast very much. The pool area was small but kept clean at all times bring something to lie on the beds round the pool are very hard and uncomfortable. The pool is cold. The wifi code you get is only one person code if you have 2 laptops or iPads with you only one at a time on the Internet. Unless you pay for another code. They try to get you one way or the other. To get to the main drag go out of the hotel and turn left about 40 yards on your left you will see a pathway take this path and walk to the end of it then turn right and you are on the main drag about 6 or 7 mins walk or you could go down to the seafront and walk that will take you about 20 mins but a nice walk. Loads of places to eat and drink. Try going to the Sunday market it is very good and very big. You can book a bus about 4 euros each or a taxi is about 20 euros each way. Overall a good quite week and I would go back to the same apartments.
reviews.title: Good, but not as good as expected

reviews.text: I have just got back from El Guarapo and on the whole was happy with the complex for what we paid but I was very disappointed with it based on my first impressions as all the reviews I had read had been very good and so I was expecting more.
reviews.title: A warm welcome awaits you at the el guarapo apartments.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we were given was on the ground floor. It was a great size but there was a thin layer of dust on everything. At first I thought the room may have been cleaned a week or so ago but had been empty since then but when I got a tissue to wipe the dressing table it was covered in foundation so that didn't seem to be the case at all.
reviews.title: Simple but wonderfully maintained - great location..

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week as a base for a scuba diving holiday with Calipso diving down the road. The apartment had all we needed - nice patio and lounge area to chill out in while we went through our day's photos and log books, basic kitchen which we mainly used for storing breakfast and lunch items and a decent sized bedroom and bathroom area with bath and shower. The bath and outside drying area on our private patio were particularly useful for rinsing and drying our swim stuff and dive gear!
reviews.title: Lovely little apartment complex and great value

reviews.text: There are plenty of supermarkets within 5-10 mins walk of the apartment that stock plenty of fresh fruit, fresh bread etc and bottled water is very cheap. If you like diving, Calipso diving are also only 10 mins walk from the apartments and can pick you up on your first day so you can transfer your dive gear to the centre and will also run you back with it when you have finished your diving.
reviews.title: "El Crappo"

reviews.text: We decided not to use the holiday package coach transfer as we were already delayed by 3 hours due to Monarch plane problems and didn't fancy waiting around and stopping at several other hotels en route. A taxi to / from the airport from el Guarapo is about €22 each way and was worth every penny! the taxi dropped us off right outside.
reviews.title: counting down the days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we were so late arriving, the reception was closed (as per other posts, they keep quite sporadic opening hours!). However, Antonio was expecting us and directed us to the apartment which was open with the keys there ready for us. We only had a quick drink on arrival at the bar and a bit of lunch on our last day at the on site restaurant as we were mainly self catering and eating out around town in the evenings, but saw Antonio every day and he was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: El Guarapo almost perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is not heated, so a little 'fresh' but nice enough and plenty of sun loungers. It would be nice to have more of the adjustable sun loungers and also cushions for them. We only spent a bit of time by the pool as we were out diving most of the time, but I can imagine if you were sunbathing every day, they wouldn't have been all that comfortable - we saw a few people had bought lilos to put on their loungers! Also even though you pay for use of the Wi-Fi, it can be quite slow and sometimes difficult to connect. However, if you speak to reception, they reset the server and it then runs and connects much better.
reviews.title: Roses1993 El Guarapo 16 September 2013

aka: El Guarapo Apartments Hotel Costa Teguise
